response:
Urgent neuroimaging is required to confirm the anatomical lesions and differentiate between ischaemia, inflammation, and neoplasia. Serological testing for specific antibodies (AQP4, MOG) is critical for diagnosis and guiding long-term immunotherapy. CSF analysis is essential to check for oligoclonal bands and exclude infection.

investigations = ["MRI Brain and Cervical Spine with contrast", "Serum Aquaporin-4 (AQP4) antibodies", "Serum Myelin Oligodendrocyte Glycoprotein (MOG) antibodies", "Lumbar puncture (CSF analysis for protein, glucose, cell count, oligoclonal bands)", "Visual Evoked Potentials (VEP)", "Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT)", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Serum Glucose", "HbA1c", "Serum ACE", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ANCA, ENA)", "Serum Vitamin B12", "Serum Folate", "Syphilis serology", "HIV serology"]
